alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 4:20PM PDT until July 31 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Kern and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 530 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Onyx, Weldon, Bear Peak, Pascoes, Blackrock and Kernville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
